item.title: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2: Legacy of the Forge - How to Level Up Prestige
item.description:
In the Legacy of the Forge DLC for Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , Henry joins the Blacksmiths' Guild and takes over a ruined forge. To upgrade the forge, which becomes his house, including chambers, the backyard, and the exterior, Henry will need to pay Groschen. However, each upgrade is also locked behind a Prestige level .

What Is Prestige In Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2?

Prestige is a new stat that can be found in the Player Menu below Henry's main stats, such as Strength and Speech. With each level of Prestige gained , Henry will be able to furnish his chambers or forge with new upgrades or cosmetic options .

Naturally, players will want to know how to increase Prestige quickly in KCD2 , so that they can unlock the best forge upgrades, with one of the last being a raven for Henry's chambers.

Play Through The Legacy Of The Forge Quests

Pretty much all the Legacy of the Forge quests reward Prestige , as Henry is usually helping the guild in one way or another. A few of these quests may be locked until Henry increases his Prestige via other means, but once they become available, they are great sources of Prestige.

Complete Daily Guild Quests For Prestige & Groschen

After advancing through part of the Legacy of the Forge DLC and completing Klaus' Introduction Task , players will unlock daily Guild Quests . These are the best ways to earn Prestige .

These Guild Quests have an orange icon , and players will usually get three new quests a day . If you're trying to grind Prestige with nothing else to do, complete these and then sleep until the next day to keep earning Prestige.

New daily quests appear at 09:00 am! (In-game time).

Blacksmith Commissions - Forge Weapons

One of the most common Guild Quest types is Blacksmith Commissions . Characters will wait at the forge or tell Magdalena and ask Henry to forge a specific weapon . Players will need the correct blueprint , which they will usually have, as well as the required materials , which can be bought from fellow smiths. If players don't know the recipe , there will be a map marker for where they can learn it . Master Bushek the Elder, next to the Hangman's Halter tavern, has a lot of sketches .

Make sure the weapon is of high quality, as customers expect the best . If you produce something of a Bronze quality, it's best to start again . Also, remember to sharpen the weapon before delivering.

To earn extra Groschen, forge any items and put them in the Sales Chest to be sold over time by Magdalena. Make sure to check back with her every few days.

Donations

The first donation quest will be Magdalena asking Henry to deliver eggs to a priest. This isn't the donation, but a means of introducing Henry to Father Frantishek . He will tell Henry that he can periodically donate at the church box next to him . In return for some Groschen, Henry will gain Prestige. It seems that the more you give, the more you gain .

However, there is then a cooldown before Henry can donate again , so players will need to wait for the next daily donation quest to appear many days later. This donation box is different from Indulgence Chests, where Henry restores Reputation.

Archery Contest

The first time players have the Archery quest, they will talk to a member of the guild and then be taken by his apprentice to a range by a quarry. Try to win so that the guild can continue to shoot here . After that, archery contests will pop up from time to time, and are a good way to earn some extra Prestige while betting Groschen . Having a high Marksmanship skill will naturally help.

Also, make sure to bring a bow with you and equip it . Arrows are not needed.

Dice Games

Henry's first dice game with a guild member happens early on, and they are one of the quickest ways to earn Prestige if players can reliably win . Having the best dice in KCD2 helps significantly.

Duels

Another of the daily Guild Quests is duels . These are naturally a great option for those who have leveled up Henry's combat skills, allowing them to finish off opponents fast and gain Prestige .

Investigation

Investigation tasks with the eye icon seem to be handed out by Master Klaus Eichner at his workshop/house. They involve hunting down bandits who have attacked guild convoys . While they may take a fair amount of time, players will usually find plenty of materials for blacksmithing , and any armor looted from bandits can be put in the Sales Chest.

Feel free to turn down or ignore these daily quests; Henry will not suffer a Prestige loss, and there will be new quests on the morrow.

Unlock Some Forge Upgrades That Provide Prestige Boosts

While Prestige is mostly used to unlock new upgrades for Henry's forge and chambers, there are a few upgrades that, in turn, increase his Prestige gains . If players are focused on farming Prestige in KCD2 , they should aim to unlock these as soon as possible for maximum efficiency .

Circular Chandelier

  • Prestige Required: 8
  • Groschen: 360
  • Effect: Permanently adds a 10% gain to Prestige, while also increasing reading quality.

Rustic Stove

  • Prestige Required: 10
  • Groschen: 460
  • Effect: Permanently adds a 10% gain to Prestige, while also increasing sleep quality.

item.title: Stardew Valley Tips
item.description:
There are plenty of things to do in Stardew Valley, so much so that some players might feel lost as soon as they start a new save file. This is a big game that has a lot of stuff for players to keep track of, so it's no surprise why some people get confused even before their first harvest season.

Thankfully, Stardew Valley is a lot simpler than one might think. Beyond the myriad of stuff to do is a cozy game that doesn't require much technical knowledge. Still, if you find yourself struggling in the early parts of the game, here are some tips to help you figure out what you need to do next.

Explore First, Farm Later

When you first start a new save, the best thing you can do is to start exploring the town and its surroundings first . Players might be eager to start farming as soon as they start, and while doing so is perfectly fine, exploring the area first is better for the following reasons:

  • Exploring is more stamina-efficient than farming early on.
  • Looting and foraging is lucrative, and it can help jumpstart your farming later.

Befriend Everyone on Your First Year

The townsfolk of Stardew Valley are more than eager to help out their newest farmer, but before they can give you any gifts or favors, you'll have to become friends with them first.

Try to reach a two-heart relationship ranking with as many NPCs as you can during your first year . This way, you'll have plenty of people providing you with support in the form of gifts and recipes. Some may even ask you to complete some quests for them, which will give you even more rewards after you complete them.

Give Food Away as Gifts

If you want to improve your relationship with an NPC more quickly, try giving them food as gifts . These tend to be more cost-efficient, and they also give more points compared to other gift types. However, always keep an NPC's preferences in mind — if you give them something that they don't particularly like, you might end up harming your relationship with them instead.

This is also a good way to fast track your romance attempts on an NPC.

Best Crops to Plant Early

There are quite a few options when it comes to what sort of crop you can plant early on, though some are more lucrative than others. When picking which seeds to buy and plant, keep the following in mind:

  • Potato grows best during Spring. They take 6 days to fully grow, and they sell for 80-160G by default based on quality. They have a chance to yield another Potato when harvested.
  • Blueberry is best for Summer. They take 13 days to grow, and are sold for 50-100G by default based on quality.
  • Cranberries are the best early crops for Fall. They grow in 7 days, and they sell for 75-150G.

Parsnips are also very good as a starting crop early on, but you need to dedicate a lot of time and energy on them. Hops are also decent, but in order to maximize your profits from them, you need to turn Hops into Pale Ale, which you won't be able to do until much later.

Always plan your crop schedule based on how long your chosen crops take to grow. Also, always take seasons into account so you don't end up potentially wasting your crops.

How to Make Money Fast Early in Stardew Valley

You can get a lot of Gold early by befriending Caroline (Pierre's wife) in Pelican Town to get the crafting recipe for Tea Saplings . Once you get the recipe, gather the ingredients needed to make them, then sell the saplings for 250G per piece.

You can also plant the saplings to harvest Tea Leaves , but the saplings themselves sell for more while requiring less time. However, you will need to actively gather Tea Sapling crafting materials if you want to use them as one of your main income sources.

Save Animal Husbandry for Later

Taking care of farm animals is fun, but it can be pretty expensive, especially if you try to divert some of your resources into getting barns, feed, and whatnot as soon as the options become available. With that being said, hold off on getting farm animals until you get a stronger and more stable source of income.

The best time to start animal husbandry is either late into your second year or early into your third year. Either way, you'll want to get farm animals eventually so you can make and sell more expensive products.

When in Doubt, Sell Cheese

If you're not sure what sort of animal products to sell at first, Cheese will likely be your best option. Not only do they sell well, but they can also be eaten to restore a large portion of your health and energy. The downside to making Cheese is that it takes a while to make some, and you'll need a Cheese Press to process them.

Still, once you get your animal farm going, Cheese is one of the best products to make next to Mayonnaise and Truffle Oil , though sell prices will differ based on the ingredients you use and the final quality of the products themselves.

Keep Some Stuff For Yourself

As mentioned above, some items also benefit players in ways outside of providing them with just money. You can prepare the food that you grow on your farm to make meals that can restore health and energy, allowing you to do more things per day, and thus letting you earn more money depending on how productive you can be.

Some great food items to make/keep are:

  • Complete Breakfast
  • Bean Hotpot
  • Red Plate

Always Check the Weather Forecast

Your day can play out very differently depending on the weather conditions in Stardew Valley . For example, rain will automatically water all of your crops for you, which means you won't have to spend any energy manually watering every crop on your farm. However, this also makes some NPCs unavailable, potentially throwing a wrench into your plans.

The weather changes daily, and you can check what tomorrow will bring by interacting with your TV and checking the Weather Report. Once you familiarize yourself with how weather works, you'll be able to make the most out of their positive and negative effects.

Place Chests (Almost) Everywhere

You're bound to fill your inventory up whenever you go foraging or exploring, especially when you go down into the mines. You can make inventory management a little bit easier by making chests and placing them along your usual routes. Having a few stashes out in the world is a great way to make sure that you always have space for valuable loot.

Stardew Valley
74
9.2 /10
Released
February 26, 2016

item.title: Things That Don't Make Sense in The Sims Universe
item.description:
The Sims universe is unique and quirky across the several games in the series. This is why fans continue to come back to their favorite game, whether it's an older entry, such as The Sims 2 , or the most recent one, The Sims 4 .

Whether it's to add to the game's quirkiness or to make gameplay more engaging, some things in The Sims just wouldn't make sense in the real world, and this article lists some of them.

Sims Can't Multitask

Especially While Cooking

Sims have a queue with several tasks that the player can line up for them. However, the ability to multitask in the game is nearly null. There is a handful of tasks that can be completed while Sims do other things, such as talking or sitting, but it's not as complex as it could and should be, especially if the developers want to improve the game's realism.

This is particularly frustrating if the player queues up a longer task, such as making a grand meal or baking a cake. The Sim can only stand there and occasionally look in the oven while they wait for their meal to cook. If it's going to be in the oven for a long time, it would make sense for this to become a secondary task and allow the Sim to do something else while they wait - even if it's just something simple like cleaning the kitchen or going to the bathroom. If this feature were to be incorporated into the game, it'd be fun for it to be unlockable as gamers level up their Cooking Skill.

Can't Make Plans for Later

It's Either Now or Never

Whenever a Sim calls and asks another Sim on a date or for any other type of social gathering, players can only accept and stop whatever they're doing to go over right there and then, or they have to refuse the invite altogether. It's not possible to agree, but schedule it for later on in the day. For many players, this puts them off accepting an invite because they've queued up some actions or their Sim still needs to take care of Needs.

Additionally, Simmers cannot throw a party for a certain time of the day without resorting to mods. Once players fill out all of the social event settings, it immediately begins.

No Job Interviews

You Want It, You Got It

Even though Sims can go to university and get a degree, this isn't actually a requirement for any of the jobs available in-game; it only gives them some advantages, like starting at a higher career level. It is simply not realistic to be able to join many of the careers available in The Sims without some form of higher education.

The Passage of Time

Sims Take Really Long Showers

In The Sims 4 , Sims will become pregnant and give birth within about three in-game days. So, it only takes 72 hours for a Sim newborn to join the family. However, it takes around two to three hours for a Sim to take a shower. If we do the math and compare it to the real world, it would mean that Sims take about 274 hours to shower, which is the equivalent of 11 days.

Three hours is more than necessary for a Sim to shower, as it makes it hard to get ready for work on time; one hour would work best. While 15-minute showers wouldn't be long enough, especially for Simmers who play on 3x speed, three hours feels like way too much time for a quick shower.

Players who want to add realism to their game can use mods, such as MC Command Center, or change how long it takes for their Sims to give birth.

Price Discrepancies

Toilet Paper is a Luxury

Toilet paper is one of the various decorative items that players can place in their bathrooms in The Sims . While they can't interact with it, it adds realism to a build. In The Sims 4 , toilet paper costs 40 Simoleons.

While it may not sound like much since Sims get paid quite well whenever they go to work, it is when compared to the price of a house. The cheapest homes in The Sims 4 cost about 20,000 Simoleons. So, while toilet paper is very expensive, houses are very affordable.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Reveals New Battle Royale Details
item.description:
Battlefield 6 has given fans a closer look at what to expect from the game's battle royale mode. Titles like Fortnite and Call of Duty: Warzone have lifted the battle royale genre to staggering heights, so it was unsurprising when leaks first emerged that EA might introduce such a mode to the next entry in the Battlefield franchise. With Battlefield 6 now just a month away, the details are starting to clear up.

Despite not even being out yet, the first-person shooter is already off to an impressive start. On the PlayStation store, Battlefield 6 is outpacing Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 pre-orders, and its open beta beat Call of Duty 's all-time concurrent player count record on Steam by at least 30,000 users. The beta has now wrapped up, but some lucky gamers are still playtesting it through the closed Battlefield Labs program, leading to a steady stream of new info for those waiting for release day.

Battlefield Labs Reveals Details on Battlefield 6's Battle Royale Map, Vehicles, and More

A September 10 Battlefield Labs community update detailed a few of the battle royale mode's unique features. Notably, it will have what devs call "the deadliest ring in BR." Shrinking rings to push players closer together are a staple of the genre, but Battlefield 6 's will carry a new sense of urgency, killing users instantly upon contact. With no way to delay or go in and out of the ring, the mode should be full of action. As confirmed by an earlier leak of Battlefield 6 's battle royale gameplay, the battle royale also features destructible environments, with the update saying destruction is "everywhere in this mode."

Beyond the destruction, the mode will feature a massive map with a lot of variety across its locations and points of interest. To help players get around, transport vehicles will litter the arena. These will be different from the combat vehicles seen in an earlier Battlefield 6 leak, as they're meant mainly for transport, not for taking out enemies. However, armored vehicles will also be available for teams to unlock.

Speaking of teams, the battle royale mode will have 25 of them, consisting of four players each for a grand total of 100 participants. While 100-player matches are common in other battle royales, Battlefield 6 has shifted back to 64-player lobbies after 2042 's 128-user games failed to impress. EA does say matches will work this way "for this test," so things could change before the final build of the game. Beyond this, Battlefield 6 's battle royale will offer "multiple tools" to give squadmates second chances besides the revives and mobile redeploys the Support class has at its disposal. Players also won't be able to change classes once the match starts, weapons and other loot will be availble to find throughout the map, and squads will have missions to gain XP and earn rewards.

Like all Battlefield Labs updates, none of these details are final, so fans should note that the full game may look and work differently. Battlefield 6 releases on October 10, 2025, so it won't take long to know for sure.

item.title: One of the Rarest Pokemon TCG Cards Ever is Up for Auction
item.description:
One of the rarest Pokemon TCG cards to ever exist is up for auction. This particular Pokemon TCG card was printed by mistake, at the very beginning of the card game's release in the west, and for all intents and purposes, it wasn't supposed to exist anymore.

Pokemon TCG cards can cost quite a bit, especially when they're new and particularly powerful releases. However, older cards that are rare are the real show-stoppers, with classics like the Charizard holo or Pikachu Illustrator card selling for hundreds of thousands of dollars or even millions, depending on their condition. Now, another card is looking to secure a similar amount.

Pokemon TCG Card That Shouldn't Still Exist is Up for Auction

An incredibly rare Raichu Pokemon TCG card has gone up for auction, which reportedly shouldn't even exist anymore. While the Raichu card looks fairly normal, the description reveals that this is a pre-release card that was printed in 1999, but it was made by mistake. Prior to the launch of Pokemon TCG in the west, Wizards of the Coast held test battles and awarded four special pre-release cards. However, a fifth version, this Raichu, was apparently made. Since it wasn't supposed to be printed, the majority were destroyed, with only eleven allegedly surviving by being taken by then-employees.

Those who are interested in this particular Pokemon TCG collectors' holy grail will need some substantial cash to acquire it. At the time of publication, the card is currently listed at $135,000 USD at Heritage Auctions, with eight days remaining for that number to rise. The card has been verified for authenticity by the PSA and graded, which granted it an EX-MT 6 PSA rating. This rating is used for cards that may have visible surface wear, a light scratch, a loss of gloss, or minor edgewear. While not as ideal as a Gem Mint 10 card, there's no guarantee that a pre-release Raichu in that condition still exists. This one could have the best quality of the remaining copies.

For now, it remains to be seen if this card has the same level of demand as the legendary Pikachu Illustrator. A copy of that Pokemon TCG card sold for over $5 million, which would be hard to match. It's worth noting, though, that only 11 Raichu cards were rescued, making it even rarer than Pikachu Illustrator, which saw 39 cards distributed via a contest.
